result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mykell G Golden

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mykell G Golden appeared by video.  Attorney Daniel Morgan Adams appeared by video for Mykell G Golden.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requests motion hearing date. Defense motions filed 8/12/2022, state's reply due 11/4/2022. 
Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
OFF THE RECORD. Case is rescheduled at the request of Attorney Adams who is in jury trial in Waukesha County. Parties notified.
Cover letter, Revised Motion to Dismiss, filed.
Defendant's Revised Motion to Dismiss, filed.
Court is DOWN on 9/6, case has been rescheduled to 09/21/2022 at 8:30AM

Defendant Mykell G Golden in court with attorney Daniel Morgan Adams.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mykell G Golden appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense requests an adjournment for reasons stated on the record. Case adjourned to Br 30.  Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defense Motion to Dismiss for Lack of Probable Cause Within the Criminal Complaint, filed.
Notice of Retainer, Received and Filed.

Adjustment Number: 22A 059430,
Payable Number: 1015941,
Receipt Number: 22RP025936,
Amount: $20.00

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Mykell G Golden in court.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/25/2022@2:30p
